p: Leaves, stems, and fruits of C. gileadensis were collected at the Ein Gedi Botanical Garden. The plant was identified and collected by Nativ Dudai. Plant parts were placed within a Clevenger-type apparatus for 1.5 h and the essential oil was hydro-distilled. The commercial samples were produced by a steam distillation apparatus and supplied by the grower Mr. Guy Erlich from his plantation at Almog (near the Dead Sea), Israel.
